thag16.1:1.1: “Those who we killed in the past,
thag16.1:1.2: whether for sacrifice or for wealth,
thag16.1:2.2: you look even calmer than before.
thag16.1:3.2: for one without hope, village chief.
thag16.1:3.4: by one whose fetters have ended.
thag16.1:4.1: When attachment to rebirth is ended,
thag16.1:4.2: and the truth is seen as it is,
thag16.1:4.3: there is no fear of death;
thag16.1:4.4: it’s like laying down a burden.
thag16.1:5.1: I’ve lived the spiritual life well,
thag16.1:5.2: and developed the path well, too.
thag16.1:5.4: it’s like the passing of a disease.
thag16.1:6.1: I’ve lived the spiritual life well,
thag16.1:6.2: and developed the path well, too.
thag16.1:6.3: I’ve seen that there’s nothing gratifying in existences,
thag16.1:6.4: like someone who has tasted poison, then thrown it out.
thag16.1:7.1: One who has gone beyond, without grasping,
thag16.1:7.2: they’ve completed the task and are free of defilements.
thag16.1:7.3: They are content at the end of life,
thag16.1:8.2: without needing anything in the whole world,
thag16.1:8.4: for it’s like escaping from a burning house.
thag16.1:9.3: there is no Lord of all that:
thag16.1:10.2: as it was taught by the Buddha
thag16.1:10.3: doesn’t grab on to any new life,
thag16.1:10.4: like you wouldn’t grab a hot iron ball.
thag16.1:11.1: It doesn’t occur to me, ‘I existed in the past’;
thag16.1:11.2: nor, ‘I will exist in the future’.
thag16.1:12.3: and the bare process of conditions,
thag16.1:12.4: there is no fear, village chief.
thag16.1:13.1: The world is like grass and sticks:
thag16.1:13.2: when this is seen with wisdom,
thag16.1:13.3: not finding anything to be mine,
thag16.1:13.4: you won’t grieve, thinking ‘I don’t have it’.
thag16.1:14.1: I’m fed up with the body;
thag16.1:14.3: This body will be broken up,
thag16.1:15.3: I won’t be angry or attached
thag16.1:16.3: the young men laid down their swords
thag16.1:18.1: “The knower of all, the seer of all:
thag16.1:18.3: He is a Teacher of great compassion,
thag16.1:19.4: you can gain the sorrowless state.”
thag16.1:20.1: When the bandits heard the good words of the hermit,
thag16.1:20.2: they laid down their swords and weapons.
thag16.1:20.3: Some refrained from their former deeds,
thag16.1:21.1: When they had gone forth in the teaching of the Holy One,
thag16.1:21.2: those astute ones developed the awakening factors and the powers.
thag16.1:21.4: they realized the state of quenching, the unconditioned.
